snippet: A backlog in processing claims in California and layoffs tied to the federal government shutdown pushed weekly claims up by 66,000, to 374,000.
abstract: Labor Department reports that applications for weekly unemployment benefits rose by 66,000 to a seasonally adjusted 374,000; sharp increase was largely caused after California processed huge backlog of claims and after partial government shutdown prompted layoffs.
lead_paragraph: A backlog in processing claims in California and layoffs tied to the federal government shutdown pushed weekly claims up by 66,000, to 374,000.

headline.main: U.S. Jobless Claims Show Sharp Increase
headline.print_headline: U.S. Jobless Claims Show Sharp Increase
